required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational Study of Methoxy Polyethylene Glycol-epoetin Beta in Participants With a Kidney Transplant
clinical_study.official_title: Non-interventional, Observational Study to Investigate the Efficiency and Safety of Mircera in Patients With a Kidney Transplant

brief_summary.textblock: This observational study will investigate efficacy and safety of methoxy polyethyleneglycol-epoetin beta in participants with a kidney transplant. Data of each participant will be collected over 15 months of Mircera therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Hemoglobin Value of 11-12 Grams Per Deciliter (g/dL) From Visit 7 (Month 7) to Visit 9 (Month 9)
Percentage of Participants With a Hemoglobin Value of 11-13 g/dL From Visit 7 (Month 7) to Visit 9 (Month 9)
Percentage of Participants With a Hemoglobin Value of 11-13 g/dL From Visit 7 (Month 7) to Visit 12 (Month 12)
Percentage of Participants With a Hemoglobin Value of 11-13 g/dL From Visit 7 (Month 7) to Visit 15 (Month 15)
Percentage of Participants With a Hemoglobin Value of 10-13 g/dL From Visit 7 (Month 7) to Visit 12 (Month 12)
Percentage of Participants With a Hemoglobin Value of 10-13 g/dL From Visit 7 (Month 7) to Visit 15 (Month 15)
Average Duration in Months Mircera Was Administered at Current Dose After the Previous Dose Adjustment

secondary_outcome.measure: Hemoglobin Level Based on the Type of Kidney Transplantation Performed
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 2, Month 3, Month 4, Month 5, Month 6, Month 7, Month 8, Month 9, Month 10, Month 11, Month 12, Month 13, Month 14, Month 15 and Entire study (Month 1 to Month 15)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were classified based on the type of kidney transplantation they underwent before entering in to the study in to two groups; participants who received living donation and participants who received cadaveric donation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hemoglobin Level Based on the Presence of Inflammatory Diseases
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 2, Month 3, Month 4, Month 5, Month 6, Month 7, Month 8, Month 9, Month 10, Month 11, Month 12, Month 13, Month 14, Month 15 and Entire study (Month 1 to Month 15)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were classified based on the presence of other inflammatory diseases at baseline in to two groups; participants with presence of inflammatory diseases and participants with absence of inflammatory diseases.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hemoglobin Level Based on the Etiology of Chronic Kidney Disease
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 2, Month 3, Month 4, Month 5, Month 6, Month 7, Month 8, Month 9, Month 10, Month 11, Month 12, Month 13, Month 14, Month 15 and Entire study (Month 1 to Month 15)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were classified based on the etiology of chronic kidney disease. The different etiological reasons included diabetic vasculopathy, hypertensive nephrosclerosis, glomerulonephritis, polycystic kidney, chronic pyelonephritis, other reasons and origin unknown. Hemoglobin levels in participants who had etiology of chronic kidney disease as 'glomerulonephritis' or 'other reasons' were presented as these were the majority of the etiological reasons for chronic kidney disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hemoglobin Level Based on the Acute Bleeding Episode(s) During the Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 2, Month 3, Month 4, Month 5, Month 6, Month 7, Month 8, Month 9, Month 10, Month 11, Month 12, Month 13, Month 14, Month 15 and Entire study (Month 1 to Month 15)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were classified in to two groups based on the presence of acute bleeding episodes during the study; presence or absence of bleeding episodes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hemoglobin Level Based on the Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 2, Month 3, Month 4, Month 5, Month 6, Month 7, Month 8, Month 9, Month 10, Month 11, Month 12, Month 13, Month 14, Month 15 and Entire study (Month 1 to Month 15)
secondary_outcome.description: GFR is described as the flow rate of filtered fluid through the kidney and was determined using the Cockcroft-Gault formula to calculate the creatinine clearance. For males, creatinine clearance [milliliters per minute (mL/min)] = [(140 minus age) multiplied by (*) (body weight in kilogram [kg]) divided by [72 * serum creatinine milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL)]. For females, creatinine clearance (mL/min) = 0.85 * [(140 minus age) * (body weight in kg)] divided by [72 * serum creatinine (mg/dL)]. Participants were classified based on the GFR in to two groups; GFR less than (<) 30 mL/min and in the range of 30-60 mL/min and hemoglobin levels at different visits were presented.

arm_group.description: Participants with kidney transplant and a chronic kidney disease who were receiving methoxy polyethylene glycol epoetin beta (Mircera) as part of their medical care.

study_pop.textblock: Participants with kidney transplant prescribed methoxy polyethyleneglycol-epoetin beta

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants with kidney transplant and a chronic kidney disease (CKD), who need erythropoiesis stimulating agent (ESA) therapy as part of their medical care and prescribed methoxy polyethyleneglycol-epoetin beta by the doctor.
- The transplant should function regularly and without need of continuous dialysis treatment at inclusion and also during the documentation period of this study according to treating physician's prognosis.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Kidney transplantation dates back less than 3 months. Acute decrease of hemoglobin (Hb) before enrollment, defined as decrease of greater than or equal to (>/=) 2 g/dL between two sequential values.
- Administration of other ESA therapies during the observation period.

facility.name: Klinikum Hann. Münden, Nephrologisches Zentrum Niedersachsen

group.title: Kidney Transplant Participants
group.description: Participants with chronic kidney disease who underwent kidney transplantation and received methoxy polyethylene glycol epoetin beta (Mircera) as part of their medical care were observed and documented for up to 15 months.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Did not receive any Mircera dose

baseline.population: Safety analysis set included participants who received at least 1 dose of study treatment. Age was reported for N=278 participants since data for 1 participant was missing.

outcome.title: Hemoglobin Level Based on the Etiology of Chronic Kidney Disease
outcome.description: Participants were classified based on the etiology of chronic kidney disease. The different etiological reasons included diabetic vasculopathy, hypertensive nephrosclerosis, glomerulonephritis, polycystic kidney, chronic pyelonephritis, other reasons and origin unknown. Hemoglobin levels in participants who had etiology of chronic kidney disease as 'glomerulonephritis' or 'other reasons' were presented as these were the majority of the etiological reasons for chronic kidney disease.

outcome.population: Efficacy analysis set. Participants who were evaluable for the specified group were included and n = number of participants who were evaluable at a particular visit.

group.title: Glomerulonephritis-Kidney Transplant Participants
group.description: Participants with glomerulonephritis as the cause of chronic kidney disease who underwent kidney transplantation and received methoxy polyethylene glycol epoetin beta (Mircera) as part of their medical care were observed and documented for up to 15 months.

group.title: Other Reason-Kidney Transplant Participants
group.description: Participants with unspecified other reasons as the cause of chronic kidney disease who underwent kidney transplantation and received methoxy polyethylene glycol epoetin beta (Mircera) as part of their medical care were observed and documented for up to 15 months.

measure.title: Hemoglobin Level Based on the Etiology of Chronic Kidney Disease
measure.description: Participants were classified based on the etiology of chronic kidney disease. The different etiological reasons included diabetic vasculopathy, hypertensive nephrosclerosis, glomerulonephritis, polycystic kidney, chronic pyelonephritis, other reasons and origin unknown. Hemoglobin levels in participants who had etiology of chronic kidney disease as 'glomerulonephritis' or 'other reasons' were presented as these were the majority of the etiological reasons for chronic kidney disease.
measure.population: Efficacy analysis set. Participants who were evaluable for the specified group were included and n = number of participants who were evaluable at a particular visit.

outcome.title: Hemoglobin Level Based on the Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR)
outcome.description: GFR is described as the flow rate of filtered fluid through the kidney and was determined using the Cockcroft-Gault formula to calculate the creatinine clearance. For males, creatinine clearance [milliliters per minute (mL/min)] = [(140 minus age) multiplied by (*) (body weight in kilogram [kg]) divided by [72 * serum creatinine milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL)]. For females, creatinine clearance (mL/min) = 0.85 * [(140 minus age) * (body weight in kg)] divided by [72 * serum creatinine (mg/dL)]. Participants were classified based on the GFR in to two groups; GFR less than (<) 30 mL/min and in the range of 30-60 mL/min and hemoglobin levels at different visits were presented.
outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 2, Month 3, Month 4, Month 5, Month 6, Month 7, Month 8, Month 9, Month 10, Month 11, Month 12, Month 13, Month 14, Month 15 and Entire study (Month 1 to Month 15)
outcome.population: Efficacy analysis set. Participants who were evaluable for the specified group were included and n = number of participants who were evaluable at a particular visit.

group.title: GFR (<30 mL/Min)-Kidney Transplant Participants
group.description: Participants with GFR <30 mL/min with chronic kidney disease who underwent kidney transplantation and received methoxy polyethylene glycol epoetin beta (Mircera) as part of their medical care were observed and documented for up to 15 months.

group.title: GFR (30-60 mL/Min)-Kidney Transplant Participants
group.description: Participants with GFR in the range of 30-60 mL/min with chronic kidney disease who underwent kidney transplantation and received methoxy polyethylene glycol epoetin beta (Mircera) as part of their medical care were observed and documented for up to 15 months.

measure.title: Hemoglobin Level Based on the Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR)
measure.description: GFR is described as the flow rate of filtered fluid through the kidney and was determined using the Cockcroft-Gault formula to calculate the creatinine clearance. For males, creatinine clearance [milliliters per minute (mL/min)] = [(140 minus age) multiplied by (*) (body weight in kilogram [kg]) divided by [72 * serum creatinine milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL)]. For females, creatinine clearance (mL/min) = 0.85 * [(140 minus age) * (body weight in kg)] divided by [72 * serum creatinine (mg/dL)]. Participants were classified based on the GFR in to two groups; GFR less than (<) 30 mL/min and in the range of 30-60 mL/min and hemoglobin levels at different visits were presented.
measure.population: Efficacy analysis set. Participants who were evaluable for the specified group were included and n = number of participants who were evaluable at a particular visit.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
